name: Impersonating a law enforcement officer in the second degree
text:
(1)  A person commits the offense of impersonating a law enforcement officer in the second degree if, with intent to deceive, the person pretends to be a law enforcement officer.
	(2)  Impersonating a law enforcement officer in the second degree is a misdemeanor. [L 1987, c 130, pt of §3]
Case Notes
  Police officers did not violate a civil process server's Fourth Amendment rights, because the officers had probable cause to arrest the process server for impersonating a law enforcement officer; since no constitutional violation occurred, the officers were entitled to qualified immunity.  348 F. Supp. 2d 1165.
